title: Bug 9619: Move static member - Dialog details
description:
Bug 9619: Move static member - Dialog details 20020212a. Mnemonics
b. No validation on the type field. Type existence is not too expensive (done in the type wizard for super class), so it could be done. At least isValidTypeName
f. Label could say 'Select destination type:'
g.
Browse button is too small (use SWTUtil for standard button sizes)
c. Title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'. Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
e. Destination type can be source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
OB:
The browse button is too small.
The title is used for long text and when going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'.
Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
The destination type can be the source type, but the refactoring incorrectly warns that this will result in errors and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
EB:
The browse button should have a standard size.
The title should not be used for displaying long text. When going to the next page, it should not show 'Type not found'.
The dialog should only show types from the source folders of the current project.
When the destination type is the same as the source type, the refactoring should not incorrectly warn about errors or make pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the dialog for moving a static member.
2. Observe that the browse button is too small.
3. Observe that the title is used for long text and when going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'.
4. Observe that the dialog shows types from source folders of other projects.
5. Try to move the static member to the same type as the source type and observe that the refactoring incorrectly warns about errors and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
